channel.title: CVE Feed for MainWP -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for MainWP -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-23660|2024-09-26T15:11:46.677Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20maintenance%20extension
item.description: Auth. (subscriber+) SQL Injection (SQLi) vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Maintenance Extension plugin <=Â 4.1.1 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-7492|2024-08-08T02:32:08.923Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: The MainWP Child Reports plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the network_options_action() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update arbitrary options that can be leveraged for privilege escalation via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This is only exploitable on multisite instances.

item.title: CVE-2023-23639|2024-08-02T10:35:33.644Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20staging%20extension
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Staging Extension.This issue affects MainWP Staging Extension: from n/a through 4.0.3.

item.title: CVE-2023-23645|2024-08-02T10:35:33.661Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20code%20snippets%20extension
item.description: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Code Snippets Extension allows Code Injection.This issue affects MainWP Code Snippets Extension: from n/a through 4.0.2.

item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MainWP MainWP UpdraftPlus Extension.This issue affects MainWP UpdraftPlus Extension: from n/a through 4.0.6.

item.title: CVE-2024-7492|2024-08-08T15:28:04.017Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: The MainWP Child Reports plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the network_options_action() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update arbitrary options that can be leveraged for privilege escalation via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. This is only exploitable on multisite instances.
